issue.title: Revert openvpn base image to debian bullseye
issue.body: No idea what happened to debian `bookworm` image, but `apt update` simply won't work any more. So switching `oqs-openvpn` docker base image to `bullseye`.

comment.body: FYI, will merge later today as review seems not needed in order to get CI to pass and to tag release

Was it intentional to remove docker build automation completely, @vsoftco ? This change was not part of any PR as far as I can see. I only coincidentally noticed this when testing/running the (pretty broken) docker image "openquantumsafe/python". 

If so, I'd suggest closing this issue and removing https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/openquantumsafe/python/general (well, any language-wrapper docker image, actually).

comment.body: Please try again with updated `main` branch: There was a bug fixed by #184

issue.title: weird shared lib naming
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Currently the build provides liboqs.so.0.8.0 and liboqs.so.3 linking to it.

Better would be liboqs.so.3.8.0 and liboqs.so.3  to share a common prefix.

**To Reproduce**

See above, liboqs.so.0.8.0 vs liboqs.so.3

**Expected behavior**

common suffix

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: openSUSE Factory
 - OpenSSL version 3.1.0
 - Compiler version used gcc13
 - Build variables used
 -  cmake -S . -B build -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS:BOOL=ON -DOQS_DIST_BUILD:BOOL=ON

 - liboqs version 0.8.0

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

comment.body: I was only wondering why there was liboqs.so.3 being a symlink to liboqs.so.0.8.0. ... if this is accepted practice I am fine.

issue.title: Add option to exclude the compilation of OQS_randombytes_system() when a custom algorithm is specified

comment.body: This sounds like a good proposal. Would you be willing to contribute a PR for this? Best including a test case for a system with such limitations?

issue.title: 0.8.0rc1 MSVC 32-bit builds fail on Falcon with AVX
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/orgs/open-quantum-safe/discussions/1487
Originally posted by **blackbird1999** May 31, 2023 44>D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\src\sig\falcon\pqclean_falcon-512_avx2\sign.c(1033): error C2440: 'function': cannot convert fr om 'int' to '__m128i' [D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\buildmt\src\sig\falcon\falcon_512_avx2.vcxproj] 41>D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\src\sig\falcon\pqclean_falcon-1024_avx2\sign.c(1033): error C2440: 'function': cannot convert f rom 'int' to '__m128i' [D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\buildmt\src\sig\falcon\falcon_1024_avx2.vcxproj] It appears that the AVX2 code no longer matches that found here https://falcon-sign.info/falcon-round3.zip. In particular, it no longer has the #ifdef for x64/x86 that allows it to compile. I'm not sure of the steps to report such things. Thanks for your help! Sincerely, Jonathan

comment.body: Would it be sensible to add this as a known issue to the 0.8.0 release notes in github (not those in the release itself, of course)? And add this to the next milestone? 0.8.1 or 0.9.0, btw?

issue.body:
Chrome Beta now supports X25519 + Kyber{512, 768}

https://twitter.com/bwesterb/status/1668600698240393218

issue.title: Check interoperability with Google Chrome
issue.body:
Chrome Beta now supports X25519 + Kyber{512, 768}

https://twitter.com/bwesterb/status/1668600698240393218

comment.body:
![image](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/assets/57787676/e3c1e982-280f-4719-a171-715d22141617)

Now even with oqs_test_CA. HOWEVER, x25519_kyber512 doesn't work. And I also wonder what "0xeaea" is that is announced by Chromium...

issue.title: Check interoperability with Google Chrome
issue.body:
Chrome Beta now supports X25519 + Kyber{512, 768}

https://twitter.com/bwesterb/status/1668600698240393218

comment.body: Chrome only supports X25519Kyber768Draft00. The other identifier is [GREASE](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8701.html).

issue.title: 0.8.0rc1 MSVC 32-bit builds fail on Falcon with AVX
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/orgs/open-quantum-safe/discussions/1487
Originally posted by **blackbird1999** May 31, 2023 44>D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\src\sig\falcon\pqclean_falcon-512_avx2\sign.c(1033): error C2440: 'function': cannot convert fr om 'int' to '__m128i' [D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\buildmt\src\sig\falcon\falcon_512_avx2.vcxproj] 41>D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\src\sig\falcon\pqclean_falcon-1024_avx2\sign.c(1033): error C2440: 'function': cannot convert f rom 'int' to '__m128i' [D:\CDK8.1\liboqs\buildmt\src\sig\falcon\falcon_1024_avx2.vcxproj] It appears that the AVX2 code no longer matches that found here https://falcon-sign.info/falcon-round3.zip. In particular, it no longer has the #ifdef for x64/x86 that allows it to compile. I'm not sure of the steps to report such things. Thanks for your help! Sincerely, Jonathan

comment.body: Okay, I've added a note to the release notes on Github.

issue.title: update version and remove CCI triggers
issue.body:
- Update release information following release
- Remove CCI triggers from projects no longer supporting CCI

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: I think it should be possible to trigger a Github Action in a downstream repo using a similar approach.  Even if the parent job is in CircleCI, it could make a REST API call to trigger a job in Github Actions as long as it has the relevant access tokens.  Maybe something like this would help: https://dev.to/rikurouvila/how-to-trigger-a-github-action-with-an-htt-request-545
